Reviews.Title: Tween-cam par excellence!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Hawlywood "Mr. Hawlywood"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter, who's a tech-savvy 11-year-old.  She just loves discovering its features (which says something about its intuitive design), and the fact that she can tag images on-the-fly for uploading to facebook as soon as she's back at her netbook.  The color is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: nice cheap camera
Reviews.Author: ddk
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Does what its supposed to. Nice quality pics for this price range.  Compact and simple to use.  Would recommend for a cheap pocket camera to take to those places you don't want to risk your expensive one.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Jensen
Reviews.Content: Have been using this camera a couple years now; I am always the one everyone depends on for pictures--very happy with this--holds the charge a long time and easy to upload to facebook. Am disappointed in that it seems it's 'program' is no longer in function internet wise.

Reviews.Title: For my son
Reviews.Author: Diane Fox-Young
Reviews.Content: I got this for my son when he turned 12. Works great, No complaints. He is a kid..... he really has no opinion.

Reviews.Title: I Love it
Reviews.Author: Monod Anselme Michel
Reviews.Content: You are the best. I very happy to make deal with you. You are the first choice. Congratulations to all of you.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Butterginger
Reviews.Content: I got this camera right before my dad and I made a 2 week trip to Alaska in June of 2010. The old Kodak I had used AA batteries and was no longer taking pictures worth keeping. This was a spir of the moment purchase at Sam's Club so I did not have the chance to really look into it. Over 2 1/2 years later I have very positive things to say about it. It has taken quite a beating over the last several years through trips all over North America, kids (and me) dropping it from high heights, minor water spills, being dropped in snow, and countless other things. This camera came through hard and strong through everything. The only thing I really have no idea what happened and why was for some reason the video started recording in a odd file and I can only watch it in one program, VLC I believe.  The outdoor pictures turned out great, I have a few from places that look like they could be put on professional postcards. The indoor pictures can be a little grainy until you learn how to work with the flash and different settings. I never leave it on Auto as the pictures come out very blurry. This camera has a very wide selection of settings, everything from macro (Not the best but works pretty well), distant (once again, works pretty well), portrait (Works amazing! If you zoom in just a smige on this mode it turns out wonderful.) panorama (useless with kids but takes easy pictures of scenery, it even puts the other picture(s) up so you can stitch it well on the camera), and self portrait (this one leaves me in awe of the pictures it takes, outside ones are so great they are hard to describe).  This camera is not a high end camera but it is a really great camera that stands up to the beating families and live gives it. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Really Easy-share
Reviews.Author: cr
Reviews.Content: Camera performs well, "Share" software downloaded quickly and easily, and the camera is small and yet takes good pictures.  Additional features are included and unexpected in a camera that is not expensive.  Set-up and initial use can start in less than 3 hours after you open the box.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: Turtle Lady
Reviews.Content: Great little camera at an economical price.  Small and easy to carry in purse or pocket.  Love the bright colors, We chose hot lime..Easy to find in purse or backpack!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Alecia Bohan "Alecia"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  I bought it twice in fact.  My three year old broke my first and I didn't even bother looking into getting another.  I have some other camera that takes batteries and hate how fast they die - love the rechargable battery which always lasts long enough, and the battery meter on the bottom of the screen is great.  I also had an older version of the Easy Share.  I cannot see myself ever getting anything different.

Reviews.Title: Good buy!
Reviews.Author: Gayla S. Kemink "Gayla Reads!"
Reviews.Content: This was a nice new product. My daughter-in-law is very happy with the gift. It is always fun to get what you think you ordered.

Reviews.Title: A Poor Purchase
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Eliza
Reviews.Content: I actually returned this camera because it was just too inconvenient to use; the design of the buttons means that each must be pressed very hard, in a very specific place/way in order for the function to register.

Reviews.Title: Best Deal for photo & video
Reviews.Author: Arthur O'Shea
Reviews.Content: I had issues with getting the Share Button installed, not due to Kodak who were very helpful but my old computer. Now I can upload to Facebook or a friend's email. The camera takes great photos and it is the best one for the price I have ever owned. When young we had our own lab and I used a double lens reflex Icoflex, this rivals the quality of photos.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera, amazing price
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!!  I had to had a green camera, and this one stood out to me as soon as I saw it.  I purchased it and starting taking pictures right away.  I first took a picture of the sunset and was amazed on how well an $80 camera can take a picture.  I love the smart capture mode!  The share button really helps me upload my pictures to my accounts.  I recommend purchasing a case and a SD card for this camera.  Overall, AMAZING!!Pros:EverythingCons:NoneIf you want a great point and shoot, this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a large family and family out of state
Reviews.Author: Nancy Evans "Nancy Evans"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. Easyshare is the way to go, ifyou have family and friends out of state and want toshare all the activities this is the way to go.Next year we'll get a step up but this is perfect!

Reviews.Title: NOT as good as Kodak claims it to be.
Reviews.Author: K. Moteberg
Reviews.Content: Why we returned it:-The "Smart Capture" feature made 90% of the photos I took look "blown out" (white faces w/no depth). That meant that I had to figure out which Scene I wanted to use before each photo I took and that takes TIME!-The shape of the camera got in the way of my taking beautiful pictures. Sure, it's a handy size for sticking in your back pocket (if you like to do that sort of thing with a camera!) but it doesn't make for a sturdy piece of equipment to hold while steadying for the shot. It's completely square on each end, in the front and the back, so there's no groove for your thumb (in back) or finger (on front) to sit in while you steady the shot.-3x wide angle zoom is worthless. It hardly gets close to what you want to see. I took it with us to CA to Legoland and couldn't zoom in close enough to see my kid's over the railing of any rides.-The digital zoom available while using the video feature is worthless. I know it doesn't claim to do anything magical but you'd expect to get a bit more than blurry faces moving around.-It doesn't connect to the EasyShare charging base that we have for our previous Kodak EasyShare cameras. Every other camera we've purchased has come with a base to set on our charger/download base but this one didn't. I hate keeping track of cords and trying to tell the difference between all of them!

Reviews.Title: Cute on Outside
Reviews.Author: SuperMom
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak Easyshare M530 because my daughter was graduating from high school and I wanted to capture the moments of the last bird leaving the nest. Well those memories were almost lost. I thought I can't go wrong with KODAK; they've been around for years. But I did. The buttons were to close together, the pictures came out dark, the zoom in shots came out blurred. It was the camera from H--L. I even tried to talk myself into keeping it, because I felt bad about returning it, but the more I used it the more I became unhappy with my purchase. What I will tell you is that I purchased a Polaroid for daughter on Amazon at the same time and only paid $60.00 for it and it worked like the most expensive camera I have ever owned beautiful, colorful pictures. That camera saved the memories I almost lost because of the KODAK. Don't judge a camera by the price and the maker. Lesson Learned :-)

Reviews.Title: Great for STILL shots
Reviews.Author: Sammy "sally"
Reviews.Content: The camera does not take good pictures when the subject is moving.  The pictures that come out are okay, but it has to be of a subject that is still.  So I bought this camera for the purpose of taking pictures of my 2 kids...  So it does not provide me with what I need, because it is rare that you can get 2 kids to hold still long enough to get a good shot.  It also does not always focus on what you need.  It picks up the closest thing and that is what the camera will focus on.I have been happy with all of my Nikon point and shoot cameras, and will not purchase another Kodak one because of this.  I just want a simple camera that I can count on to take the picture that I want when I push the button, without spending too much money on it.  The Nikon cameras hold up to that.  I was just trying to be more environmentally friendly with this camera and the rechargeable battery in it.

Reviews.Title: bad unless you have bright light and no movement
Reviews.Author: Noah's Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son for Christmas, he said he had to have a green camera so we were limited on choices.  He likes it because it is green and small.  I feel like I wasted my money, because unless you have total bright light and whatever you are taking a picture of is so still to the point it is not even breathing - the picture quality is horrible.  Every picture is blurred.  And for a seven year old, either he is moving or what he is taking a picture of is moving.  So while he is happy, I think it was a total waste of money.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom
2.7-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature; Face Recognition feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M530 12 MP Digital Camera with 3x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)
